content.webTitle: Standard Life customers avoid share windfall tax

fields.headline: Standard Life customers avoid share windfall tax
fields.bodyText: Standard Life believes it has helped its 2.3m policyholders avoid a possible £400m tax bill when it floats on the stock market. The insurer asked revenue and customs to clarify the status of a new tax that some of its customers might have had to pay. It feared the 1 million policyholders who will receive their share windfalls into personal pension plans might have incurred tax bills at 40% as a result of rule changes being implemented in April. The possibility has been averted after negotiations with revenue and customers and means the shares will be received tax free.
